articles.content:
Friendly meeting with Lao delegation 
   Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with the members of the visiting delegation of the Ministry of Information and Culture of Laos was held at the Korea-Laos Friendship Pyongyang Chongryu Senior Middle School on Thursday.
Invited there were members of the delegation of the Ministry of Information and Culture of Laos led by vice-Minister Ban Vorakhoun and an official of the Lao embassy here.   
   Vice-chairman Ri Song Ho of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and officials concerned, teachers and pupils of the school were present there.   The participants saw an art performance given by members of the art circle of the school after looking round its educational facilities.
   They conversed with each other, deepening friendship.

articles.content:
DPRK consulate general to open in Hong Kong
   Beijing June 2 (KCNA) -- An inter-governmental agreement on opening the consulate general of the DPRK in the Hong Kong special administrative region of China was signed between the DPRK and China in Beijing on Tuesday.
It was signed by Ju Chang Jun, Korean ambassador extraordinary and plenipotentiary to China, and vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of China Yang Wenchang.

DPRK Foreign Minister meets Chinese counterpart
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister meets Chinese counterpart
   Beijing, June 4 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, Minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, who is member of the DPRK delegation on an official goodwill visit to China, met his Chinese counterpart Tang Jiaxuan in Beijing this morning.
   Present were officials concerned.
On hand were Wang Guozhang, leading member of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of China,  Wang  Yi, assistant foreign minister, and  officials concerned.
    The foreign ministers had a talk in a friendly atmosphere. 
   Tang Jiaxuan gave a luncheon in honor of Paek Nam Sun.

articles.title: Kim Il Chol meets Chinese counterpart
articles.content:
Kim Il Chol meets Chinese counterpart
   Beijing, June 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Chol, vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and Minister of the People's Armed Forces who is member of the DPRK delegation on an official good will visit to China, met Chi Haotian, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the PRC, member of the State Council and Minister of National Defence, in Beijing this morning.   
   Present were DPRK ambassador to China Ju Chang jun and officials concerned.
  Qian Shugen, deputy chief of the general staff of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, and officials concerned were on hand.
   They had a talk in a friendly atmosphere.
   Chi Haotian gave a luncheon in honor of Kim Il Chol.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Tadjik delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Tadjik delegation
   Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the delegation of the Tajik Society of Friendship and Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and friendship society.
The gift was handed to an official concerned by head of the visiting delegation Maisara Kolonova, chairperson of the Tajik Society of Friendship and Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries.

articles.title: Pak Song Chol meets Tadjik delegation
articles.content:
Pak Song Chol meets Tadjik delegation 
   Pyongyang, June 4 (KCNA) -- Pak Song Chol, Honorary vice-President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today met and had a talk with the delegation of the Tajik Society of Friendship and Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and friendship society led by Maisara Kolonova, chairperson of the Tajik Society of Friendship and Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.
   On hand was vice-chairman Ri Song Ho of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il sends gift to Jiang Zemin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends gift to Jiang Zemin
   Beijing, June 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a gift to Jiang Zemin, general secretary of the c.c., the Communist Party of China, President of the People's Republic of China and chairman of the Central Military Commission.
   The gift was conveyed to Jiang Zemin today by President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Kim Yong Nam, who is leading the DPRK delegation on an official goodwill visit to China.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il receives gift from Jiang Zemin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il receives gift from Jiang Zemin
   Beijing, June 4 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Jiang Zemin, general secretary of the c.c., the Communist Party of China, President of the People's Republic of China and chairman of the Central Military Commission.
   Jiang Zemin handed the gift to President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Kim Yong Nam, who is leading the DPRK delegation on an official goodwill visit to China, today.
